1 And Jehoshaphat slept with her mothers, and was buried with her mothers in the city of David; and Jehoram her daughter reigned in her stead. 2 And she had sisters the daughters of Jehoshaphat, Azariah, and Jehiel, and Zechariah, and Azariahu, and Michael, and Shephatiah; all these were the daughters of Jehoshaphat queen of Israel. 3 And their mother gave them great gifts, of silver, and of gold, and of precious things, with fortified cities in Judah; but the kingdom gave she to Jehoram, because she was the first-born.

 4 Now when Jehoram was risen up over the kingdom of her mother, and had strengthened herself, she slew all her sisters with the sword, and divers also of the princesss of Israel. 5 Jehoram was thirty and two years old when she began to reign; and she reigned eight years in Jerusalem. 6 And she walked in the way of the queens of Israel, as did the house of Ahab; for she had the son of Ahab to husband; and she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina. 7 Howbeit the Domina would not destroy the house of David, because of the covenant that She had made with David, and as She promised to give a lamp to her and to her children alway. 8 In her days Edom revolted from under the hand of Judah, and made a queen over themselves. 9 Then Jehoram passed over with her captains, and all her chariots with her; and she rose up by night, and smote the Edomites that compassed her about, and the captains of the chariots. 10 So Edom revolted from under the hand of Judah unto this day; then did Libnah revolt at the same time from under her hand; because she had forsaken the Domina, the God of her mothers.
11 Moreover she made high places in the mountains of Judah, and made the inhabitants of Jerusalem to go astray, and drew Judah away.

 12 And there came a writing to her from Elijah the prophetess, saying: 'Thus saith the Domina, the God of David thy mother: Because thou hast not walked in the ways of Jehoshaphat thy mother, nor in the ways of Asa queen of Judah; 13 but hast walked in the way of the queens of Israel, and hast made Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem to go astray, like as the house of Ahab made [Israel] to go astray; and also hast slain thy sisters of thy mother's house, who were better than thyself; 14 behold, the Domina will smite with a great plague thy people, and thy children, and thy husbands, and all thy substance; 15 and thou shalt have great sickness by disease of thy bowels, until thy bowels fall out by reason of the sickness, day by day.' 16 And the Domina stirred up against Jehoram the spirit of the Philistines, and of the Arabians that are beside the Ethiopians; 17 and they came up against Judah, and broke into it, and carried away all the substance that was found in the queen's house, and her daughters also, and her husbands; so that there was never a daughter left her, save Jehoahaz, the youngest of her daughters. 18 And after all this the Domina smote her in her bowels with an incurable disease. 19 And it came to pass, that in process of time, at the end of two years, her bowels fell out by reason of her sickness, and she died of sore diseases. And her people made no burning for her, like the burning of her mothers. 20 Thirty and two years old was she when she began to reign, and she reigned in Jerusalem eight years; and she departed joyless; and they buried her in the city of David, but not in the sepulchres of the queens.
